result.markdown: --- title: "🌹 Spread the 💜 for R 📦 with valentine::roses()" description: "valentine is a small R packages that uses ChatGPT via the openai package to generate roses are red ... poetry about R packages. " author: - name: Romain François affiliation: tada⬢science affiliation-url: https://tada.science date: 2024-02-14 categories: [package, valentine, poetry, ai, love] image: logo.png citation: url: https://tada.science/posts/2024-02-14-roses-are-red draft: false --- To get ready, *at least in the R world* 😝, for Valentine's day, I've cooked a little R 📦 to spread the love by generating *Roses are Red, ...* poems about packages using ChatGPT though the [openai](https://irudnyts.github.io/openai/) package. You can install it with `pak::pak("tadascience/valentine")` and perhaps it will be released to CRAN in time for Valentine's day, it's in the pipeline. If you are not already set with an `OPENAI_API_KEY`, see you later in this article, otherwise let's make some 🤖 poetry 🪶 📝 ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} valentine::roses("tidyverse") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` 🌹 Roses are red, 📦 ✨ tidyverse is my love, 💕 💡 It makes coding fun, 🤩 🌈 With tidy data, I rise above! 📊 ``` ::: ::: You can tweak the prompt that is sent with the `hint=` argument. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} valentine::roses("lubridate", hint = "make it kinky") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Roses are red 🌹 Lubridate keeps time in your bed 🕒💤 Date parsing and manipulation so fine 😍💃 It's the R package that sparks a kinky line! 🔥😉 ``` ::: ::: Before you can use `valentine::roses()` you need to be setup with an API key you can get from [OpenAI](https://platform.openai.com/account/api-keys). Once you're there, click the "Create new secret key", name it whatever you like: ![](openai-key.png){fig-align="center" width="384"} And then copy the secret key. ![](openai-key-2.png){fig-align="center" width="384"} ... and store it in your `.Renviron` file, e.g. by using `usethis::edit_r_environ()` ![](renviron.png){fig-align="center" width="384"} Restart R, and 🦆 ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} valentine::roses("data.table") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Roses are 🔴, Data.table is 💪, Efficient and 🚀, It's a 🎁 to me! ``` ::: :::
